snippet.textDisplay: I hope we get a 4. :( 3 flopped, but the first two are amazing. I love the universe overall. I still think Isaac should replace one of the Fire Emblem swordsmen in Smash Bros too.

snippet.textDisplay:
I actually... Well, let's say I liked the games less than everyone else. The game was way too easy (one accidental backtrack = completely overleveled), the statistics were broken (why do a psyenergy attack for 180 points when I have a sword that does 200, and a summon that does 400, both for free), Djinn were really overpowered (on top of hard to organize), and the story was too overwritten. I see how it's a good game, and it could be great if you use only a few Djinn, but I really don't see how it's one of the best RPGs out there. 
But dem graphics. An' dat battle theme.
snippet.textOriginal:
I actually... Well, let's say I liked the games less than everyone else. The game was way too easy (one accidental backtrack = completely overleveled), the statistics were broken (why do a psyenergy attack for 180 points when I have a sword that does 200, and a summon that does 400, both for free), Djinn were really overpowered (on top of hard to organize), and the story was too overwritten. I see how it's a good game, and it could be great if you use only a few Djinn, but I really don't see how it's one of the best RPGs out there. 
But dem graphics. An' dat battle theme.

Man, this really takes me back. I probably played through both games like 7 times already. Definitely one of my Top 5 favorite JRPGs, it's was that good.

snippet.textDisplay: Definately! The zelda like puzzles blend perfectly with the RPG elements, The first one is about 20/25 hours of gameplay the sequel finishes the story and is about 2, to 3 times as big! We'll have to wait for it, but it'll come to the VC eventually! It's really worth it if you can still apreciate the graphics (they're gorgeous, for a gba game!)

snippet.textDisplay: Dark Dawn was a decent game, it just couldn't live up to its predecessors: two of the best RPGs ever made.

snippet.textDisplay: @***** That's the thing: the first two Golden Sun games were flawless. The music is timeless and the visuals were unreal, especially for games released in the early years of the GBA. Dark Dawn is inferior by comparison, mainly because those first two games were simply unbeatable. Dark Dawn is mediocre compared to those games, but as a DS RPG that stands on its own, it's pretty decent.
snippet.textOriginal: @***** That's the thing: the first two Golden Sun games were flawless. The music is timeless and the visuals were unreal, especially for games released in the early years of the GBA. Dark Dawn is inferior by comparison, mainly because those first two games were simply unbeatable. Dark Dawn is mediocre compared to those games, but as a DS RPG that stands on its own, it's pretty decent.

snippet.textDisplay: @Videogamesnake Well, that's your opinion. I consider it to be decent.

snippet.textDisplay: Golden Sun and The Lost Age are fucking amazing. The graphics are the best on the console, the gameplay was superb, the game didn't hold your hand, it was massive and open, had fucking awesome powers, a decent story, perfect music and overall was a masterpiece.

snippet.textDisplay: @Matt Maberry There are home consoles and handheld consoles. The term "system" also works. No contradiction in calling the GBA a "handheld console".
snippet.textOriginal: @Matt Maberry There are home consoles and handheld consoles. The term "system" also works. No contradiction in calling the GBA a "handheld console".

snippet.textDisplay: I was under the impression that handhelds and consoles were two completely different items. The overarching category is video game "system". Falling under that classification are " home consoles" and "handheld systems". To say "handheld console" is a contradiction in terms. And I do not count the virtual version because it was not designed specifically for a home console.
snippet.textOriginal: I was under the impression that handhelds and consoles were two completely different items. The overarching category is video game "system". Falling under that classification are " home consoles" and "handheld systems". To say "handheld console" is a contradiction in terms. And I do not count the virtual version because it was not designed specifically for a home console.

snippet.textDisplay: This is a battle theme that really stuck with me since I played this game more than 10 years ago (wow...). I remember being amazed by this game's graphics and music quality back then. The battle system was highly impressive, especially the variety of summons. After Golden Sun 3 flopped, you have to wonder if we'll ever see a new entry in this series.
snippet.textOriginal: This is a battle theme that really stuck with me since I played this game more than 10 years ago (wow...). I remember being amazed by this game's graphics and music quality back then. The battle system was highly impressive, especially the variety of summons. After Golden Sun 3 flopped, you have to wonder if we'll ever see a new entry in this series.

snippet.textDisplay: Yeah, couldn't get through GS3. Man this game was awesome in 2001! Camelot really paid attention to the GBA, unlike too many other "Eh, just port this SNES or Genesis game" shovelware out there.
